HIHIHI ASK CHAU YEAH

The total noise level measured at a receiver is 80 dB, which is an addition of two sound effects. The first one travels over the line of sight from a noise source to the receiver, and the second one is once reflected from the ground with a 6 dB loss when comparing to the first one at the receiver. What is the noise level at the receiver when the reflected wave from the ground is absent?

If an obstacle is placed on the light of sight between the noise source and the receiver, sound will only reach the receiver by diffraction around the obstacle and reflection from the ground, and there are three propagation paths. The first path suffers 5 dB loss on reflection from the ground and 7 dB loss on diffracting over the obstacle. The second path suffers 6 dB loss on reflection from the ground and 6 dB loss on diffracting over the obstacle. Besides, the last one suffers 4 dB loss on reflection from the ground and 5 dB loss on diffracting over the obstacle. What is the total noise level at the receiver after the installation of this obstacle?
